00001 #!/usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 # Copyright (c) 2011 Google Inc. All rights reserved.
00004 # Use of this source code is governed by a BSD-style license that can be
00005 # found in the LICENSE file.
00006 
00007 """Using the JSON dumped by the dump-dependency-json generator,
00008 generate input suitable for graphviz to render a dependency graph of
00009 targets."""
00010 
00011 import collections
00012 import json
00013 import sys
00014 
00015 
00016 def ParseTarget(target):
00017   target, _, suffix = target.partition('#')
00018   filename, _, target = target.partition(':')
00019   return filename, target, suffix
00020 
00021 
00022 def LoadEdges(filename, targets):
00023   """Load the edges map from the dump file, and filter it to only
00024   show targets in |targets| and their depedendents."""
00025 
00026   file = open('dump.json')
00027   edges = json.load(file)
00028   file.close()
00029 
00030   # Copy out only the edges we're interested in from the full edge list.
00031   target_edges = {}
00032   to_visit = targets[:]
00033   while to_visit:
00034     src = to_visit.pop()
00035     if src in target_edges:
00036       continue
00037     target_edges[src] = edges[src]
00038     to_visit.extend(edges[src])
00039 
00040   return target_edges
00041 
00042 
00043 def WriteGraph(edges):
00044   """Print a graphviz graph to stdout.
00045   |edges| is a map of target to a list of other targets it depends on."""
00046 
00047   # Bucket targets by file.
00048   files = collections.defaultdict(list)
00049   for src, dst in edges.items():
00050     build_file, target_name, toolset = ParseTarget(src)
00051     files[build_file].append(src)
00052 
00053   print 'digraph D {'
00054   print '  fontsize=8'  # Used by subgraphs.
00055   print '  node [fontsize=8]'
00056 
00057   # Output nodes by file.  We must first write out each node within
00058   # its file grouping before writing out any edges that may refer
00059   # to those nodes.
00060   for filename, targets in files.items():
00061     if len(targets) == 1:
00062       # If there's only one node for this file, simplify
00063       # the display by making it a box without an internal node.
00064       target = targets[0]
00065       build_file, target_name, toolset = ParseTarget(target)
00066       print '  "%s" [shape=box, label="%s\\n%s"]' % (target, filename,
00067                                                      target_name)
00068     else:
00069       # Group multiple nodes together in a subgraph.
00070       print '  subgraph "cluster_%s" {' % filename
00071       print '    label = "%s"' % filename
00072       for target in targets:
00073         build_file, target_name, toolset = ParseTarget(target)
00074         print '    "%s" [label="%s"]' % (target, target_name)
00075       print '  }'
00076 
00077   # Now that we've placed all the nodes within subgraphs, output all
00078   # the edges between nodes.
00079   for src, dsts in edges.items():
00080     for dst in dsts:
00081       print '  "%s" -> "%s"' % (src, dst)
00082 
00083   print '}'
00084 
00085 
00086 def main():
00087   if len(sys.argv) < 2:
00088     print >>sys.stderr, __doc__
00089     print >>sys.stderr
00090     print >>sys.stderr, 'usage: %s target1 target2...' % (sys.argv[0])
00091     return 1
00092 
00093   edges = LoadEdges('dump.json', sys.argv[1:])
00094 
00095   WriteGraph(edges)
00096   return 0
00097 
00098 
00099 if __name__ == '__main__':
00100   sys.exit(main())
